page.title: 10Religion
page.content: There has been a parish{church}in Darton since Norman times.The present building was built mainly in 1517.The {vicar}is Father Seymour.Every month except August and September the Boy's Brigade marches up to the church from the Sunday School.In 1983 and 1984 some local ladies worked together to make a patch work quilt with embroidered pictures telling the history of Darton.It is hanging on a wooden frame in the church and is called Darton Heritage Quilt. The Sunday School in Church Street was built in 1818 and many groups still meet here:the Mothers Union,the Busy Fingers for younger girls,Boy's Brigade and Darton Dramatic Society. There are several Methodist chapels in the area and a Catholic church. Besides the Sunday Schools there are Youth Clubs.
